result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard K. Fibish Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------
Reimburse "buy money" to the Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit in the amount of $1,055.00.
--------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
--------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
--------------------------------

Other counseling as recommended by Agent. Take prescription medications as prescribed. Submit DNA sample if not previously provided and pay DNA surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
--------------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before March 6, 2015 @ 8:00 am. The defendant may travel to Illinois for employment purposes.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
----------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
----------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------------------

11:00 am  Court in session.  Case called. Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deft Richard K. Fibish in court, in custody with Atty Stephen M Compton.  
Matter is before the Court for a sentencing after revocation hearing.  
Court makes record as to charge and penalty.  Court has reviewed a prior PSI, Revocation Order & Summary as well as letters of support.  Court did not review any compelled statements contained in the revocation summary.  Atty Compton has reviewed these materials with his client.  
11:02 am  Court has reviewed the letter of Justina Fibish.  
11:03 am  Statement by Richard Fibish, Jr., son of defendant.  
11:04 am  Statement by Michael Flick - Mr.Flick is part of the Celebrate Recovery program at the Jail.  
11:06 am  There are no victims in this case.  
11:07 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Wiedenfeld.  
11:14 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Compton.  
11:34 am  Statement by Mr. Fibish.  
11:41 am  Court makes record and proceeds with sentencing.  

SENTENCE:  
Total length of sentence is:  
5 yrs; 8 months WSP;  
32 months of Initial Confinement;  
3 years of Extended supervision;  
584 days of sentence credit.  

CONDITIONS TO EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
The conditions of ES shall be the same as the original conditions of probation;  

Court warns deft:  1) May not vote until civil rights are restored;  2)  May not possess firearms;  11:56 am  Court in recess.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 11, 2018 at 11:00 am.

**2ND AMENDMENT 11-07-2014 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT THE NO CONTACT WITH JUSTINE FIBISH IS LIFTED.**

**AMENDMENT 07-24-2014 - The Defendant and Justina Fibish can have contact only so long as Mr. Fibish remains in Jail.

Must Post $1,500.00 Cash.   Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Any prescription must be taken exactly as prescribed.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH RICHARD K FIBISH, JR., JUSTINA FIBISH, OR ZAKARY R FIBISH.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. Reference SO#'s 14-2148 through 14-2155.
Defendant appears in court, in custody, with attorney Travis Schwantes. Dan Necci appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney.
